location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Lewis Pelly, to Narayn Wussadeojee

physicalDescription.extent: The letter book has been turned upside down and the correspondence relating to banking and financial matters has been entered from back to front, therefore the correspondence itself is upside down in relation to the folio numbers.

mods.abstract: Brief note regarding the thirty six shares and the remittence of 1000 rupees to Messrs Remington, his need of a Portuguese butlerm the lack of good arab horses available and the arrival of Alfred Hyman Louis in India.
